ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got a breadth of experiences in scientific fields that I never would have been able to otherwise? I could now follow or participate in a dialogue concerning, for example, global dimming when I never knew what it was before.
Overview of many science fields and the work that Yale professors are doing in their respective fields.

This is a great survey course. Because it is current topics, I better understood newspaper articles, could better contribute to conversations on climate change/extraterrestrial life/etc., and learned how to ethically think about science.
An overview of important topics such as stem cells, GMOs, exoplanets, and global warming.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: VERY strong and well done course! I feel that this class epitomizes what the freshman seminar is supposed to be. I know Prof. Kankel has asked many of the same professors every year to come back and teach the modules, but I would really like a module about stress! I feel that it is a pervasive topic, especially on this campus, and I realized I don't understand stress (scientifically) in a way in which I would be able to engage in a dialogue.
I enjoyed this seminar class a lot as it exposes you to a lot of material that you might not have taken a class in- definitely geared towards non-science majors.

It is great that every three weeks there is a different professor and a different topic. It keeps the class engaging. It would have been better if all the assignments and quizzes did not pile up on the third week and were instead spread out over the three.
Fascinating professors covering a wide range of key topics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially if you are not a science major, taking this yearlong seminar course will teach you a lot of current and important topics that are worth knowing.
Yes!!! Great overview of many important topics, and a perfect class for someone interested in gaining a surface understanding of many important scientific issues.
